WBPS is now Rehlko!
About Rehlko
Rehlko is a global leader in power and energy resilience, with a heritage that spans over 100 years. Since launching the first modern generator, we have continually shaped the way the world powers homes, industries, and critical infrastructure.
Today, Rehlko’s product range includes engines, generators, power conversion systems, UPS, EV components, electrification solutions, microgrid controls, clean energy technologies, and more. Our expertise serves a diverse spectrum of customers worldwide, from OEMs to industrial, commercial, and residential sectors.
As part of this exciting growth, WB Power Services has now become Rehlko UK. This transition means we retain the strong, values-led foundation of a family business, while being empowered by the scale, resources, and global vision of Rehlko. For our people, this means new opportunities, bigger projects, and a chance to shape the future of resilient, sustainable energy.

This innovative consultancy specialise in sustainability, mechanical, electrical and building services designs for varied commercial, retail, residential and industrial development projects.

You will be required to mentor team members and work from the Leicester office 4 days per week.
responsibilities_snippet:
As a Senior Electrical DesignEngineer, you’ll play a key role in mentoring team members, managing projects and delivering diverse projects, from concept through to completion. Your responsibilities will include:

- Delivering high-quality electrical designs across a wide range of commercial and residential sectors.
- Engaging in all stages of the project lifecycle and liaise with multidisciplinary teams.
- Producing technical drawings and calculations for electrical systems and lighting using Dialux, Relux, Amtech and AutoCAD.
- Contributing to sustainable design solutions and low-carbon strategies.
- Supporting site installations and ensuring design compliance.
- Representing the company at project meetings and client interactions suggesting innovative and sustainable solutions for developments. Sites are usually based across South London and Surrey.

Candidates are required to have a strong academic background in Mechanical, Electrical or Building Services Engineering and experience working for UK based Consultancy completing electrical designs using Dialux, Relux and/or Amtech.

You will also be required to have experience mentoring team members and checking technical designs.  Experience designing for both commercial and residential projects would also be beneficial.

You will also be required to have a working knowledge of British/European standards and Building Regulations and BREEAM.

Whilst this opportunity offers flexible working, you will be required to work from the office in Leicester four days a week.  You will also be required to have a valid driving licence to attend site visits across the area.

full_job_description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a **MechanicalDesignEngineer (Automotive Components)** to join a reputable manufacturing company specialising in the design and production of automotive components and accessories, particularly for original equipment (OE) applications.

As a **MechanicalDesignEngineer**, you will be responsible for transforming ideas into precision-engineered products, from prototype to production, ensuring quality, cost, and delivery targets are met.

This full-time role offers benefits and a salary of £37,000 working 37.5 hours a week.Candidates with experience in other sectors such as Chemical Process, Mining, Rail, Aerospace, Marine, etc. can also be considered.

**Key Responsibilities**
- Developing CAD concepts using CATIA V5 (surface, solid, and 2D) based on customer data and packaging constraints.
- Providing design and manufacturing input to assess feasibility, cost, and capability, coordinating with internal teams and suppliers.
- Leading design feasibility reviews and ensuring designs meet customer and internal standards.
- Creating detailed CAD models for prototype manufacture and approval.
- Create and update the Manufacturing Feasibility Report (MFR) during all stages of the project.
- Develop and validate process flows, PFMEA, Control Plans, and Standard Operating Procedures for pre-production
- Managing prototype builds, liaising with suppliers, tooling teams, and manufacturing departments.
- Overseeing the finalisation of designs for production release, ensuring the correct application of GD&T and tolerance stack-ups.
- Supporting production ramp-up and driving continuous improvement initiatives.
**What We Are Looking For**
- Previously worked as a MechanicalDesignEngineer, MechanicalEngineer, MechanicalDesigner, Product DesignEngineer, or in a similar role within an engineering design and manufacturing setting.
- Have prior experience in new product introduction (NPI) and process development
- Proficiency in CATIA V5 for 3D modelling and 2D engineering drawings.
- Strong knowledge of GD&T, datum structures, and manufacturing processes.
- A degree or HND in Mechanical, Manufacturing, or Production Engineering (or equivalent technical experience).
- Familiarity with APQP, PFMEA, Control Plans, and Lean manufacturing methods.
- Practical knowledge of the automotive industry, with experience in Tier 1 or OEM environments.
- Knowledge of IATF 16949 and associated quality management systems
- Excellent organisational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects effectively.
This is a great opportunity to join an innovative company and contribute to the development of cutting-edge automotive technologies.
